name: Coleto
description: As its name suggests, a large part of its head is bald, covered with bare pink skin. Otherwise, it is gray-black.
food_note: Mainly figs and other fruits, rarely invertebrates
image_alt: Coleto, photo: Antonín Vaidl, Prague Zoo
proportions: Length 27 cm, including tail 15–17 cm, wing length 12.5–13.5 cm, weight 110–130 g
reproduction: The female lays 2–3 eggs, incubation lasts 13–14 days.
attractions: The Coleto is a Philippine endemic (meaning it lives nowhere else in the world). It forms three subspecies, with the melanonotus subspecies being rarer. Like other starlings, it can learn to mimic various sounds, including the human voice, and is often kept in households. It nests in tree cavities up to 35 m above the ground.
